greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: O.g.f. A(x) satisfies: [x^n] exp( n*(n-1) * x ) / A(x) = 0.
comment: It is striking that the coefficients of o.g.f. A(x) consist entirely of integers.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
formula: a(n) ~ sqrt(1-c) * 2^(2*n - 1) * n^(n - 1/2) / (sqrt(Pi) * c^(n - 1/2) * (2-c)^n * exp(n)), where c = -A226775 = -LambertW(-2*exp(-2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 31 2020
example: The table of coefficients of x^k/k! in exp(n*(n-1)*x) / A(x) begins:
in which the main diagonal is all zeros after the initial term, illustrating that [x^n] exp( n*(n-1)*x ) / A(x) = 0 for n>=0.
The logarithmic derivative of A(x) yields the o.g.f. of A304316:
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A=[1]); for(i=1, n, A=concat(A, 0); m=#A; A[m] = Vec( exp(x*(m-1)*(m-2) +x*O(x^m)) / Ser(A) )[m] ); A[n+1]}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, May 11 2018
